/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: You can configure a replica of your entire GitHub Enterprise Server cluster in a separate datacenter, allowing your cluster to fail over to redundant nodes.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Initiating a failover to your replica cluster
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: If your GitHub Enterprise Server cluster fails, you can fail over to the replica.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Configuring high availability
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: GitHub Enterprise Server supports a high availability mode of operation designed to minimize service disruption in the event of hardware failure or major network outage affecting the primary appliance.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: About high availability configuration
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: In a high availability configuration, a fully redundant secondary GitHub Enterprise Server appliance is kept in sync with the primary appliance through replication of all major datastores.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Creating a high availability replica
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: In an active/passive configuration, the replica appliance is a redundant copy of the primary appliance. If the primary appliance fails, high availability mode allows the replica to act as the primary appliance, allowing minimal service disruption.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Monitoring a high-availability configuration
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: After configuration of high availability for your GitHub Enterprise Server instance, you can monitor the status of data replication among to your instance's replica nodes.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Initiating a failover to your replica appliance
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: You can failover to a GitHub Enterprise Server replica appliance using the command line for maintenance and testing, or if the primary appliance fails.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Recovering a high availability configuration
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: After failing over to a GitHub Enterprise Server appliance, you should regain redundancy as soon as possible rather than rely on a single appliance.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Removing a high availability replica
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: You can stop replication to a GitHub Enterprise Server replica temporarily, or permanently remove replication.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: About geo-replication
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: Geo-replication on GitHub Enterprise Server uses multiple active replicas to fulfill requests from geographically distributed data centers.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Caching repositories
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: You can improve performance for your geographically-distributed team with repository caching, which provides read-only mirrors close to your users and CI clients.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: About repository caching
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: You can increase the performance of Git read operations for distributed teams and CI farms with repository caching.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.title: Configuring a repository cache
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/monitor.intro: You can configure a repository cache for GitHub Enterprise Server by creating a new instance, connecting the repository cache to your primary instance, and configuring replication of repository networks to the repository cache.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.title: Managing GitHub Actions for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.intro: Enable GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server, and manage GitHub Actions policies and settings.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.title: Getting started with GitHub Actions for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.intro: Learn how to adopt GitHub Actions for your enterprise.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.title: About GitHub Actions for enterprises
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.intro: GitHub Actions can improve developer productivity by automating your enterprise's software development cycle.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.title: Introducing GitHub Actions to your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.intro: You can plan how to roll out GitHub Actions in your enterprise.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.title: Migrating your enterprise to GitHub Actions
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.intro: Learn how to plan a migration to GitHub Actions for your enterprise from another provider.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.title: Getting started with GitHub Actions for GitHub Enterprise Cloud
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.intro: Learn how to configure GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Cloud.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Getting started with GitHub Actions for GitHub Enterprise Server
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: Learn about enabling and configuring GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server for the first time.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.title: Getting started with self-hosted runners for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/github.intro: You can configure a runner machine for your enterprise so your developers can start automating workflows with GitHub Actions.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Enabling GitHub Actions for GitHub Enterprise Server
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: Learn how to configure storage and enable GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Enabling GitHub Actions with Azure Blob storage
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: You can enable GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server and use Azure Blob storage to store data generated by workflow runs.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Enabling GitHub Actions with Amazon S3 storage
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: You can enable GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server and use Amazon S3 storage to store data generated by workflow runs.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Enabling GitHub Actions with Google Cloud Storage
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: You can enable GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server and use Google Cloud Storage to store data generated by workflow runs.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Enabling GitHub Actions with MinIO storage
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: You can enable GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server and use MinIO storage to store data generated by workflow runs.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Managing self-hosted runners for Dependabot updates on your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: You can create dedicated runners for your GitHub Enterprise Server instance that Dependabot uses to create pull requests to help secure and maintain the dependencies used in repositories on your enterprise.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Managing access to actions from GitHub.com
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: Controlling which actions on GitHub.com and GitHub Marketplace can be used in your enterprise.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: About using actions in your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: GitHub Enterprise Server includes most GitHub-authored actions, and has options for enabling access to other actions from GitHub.com and GitHub Marketplace.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Enabling automatic access to GitHub.com actions using GitHub Connect
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: To allow GitHub Actions in your enterprise to use actions from GitHub.com, you can connect your enterprise instance to GitHub Enterprise Cloud.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Manually syncing actions from GitHub.com
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: For users that need access to actions from GitHub.com, you can sync specific actions to your enterprise.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Using the latest version of the official bundled actions
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: You can update the actions that are bundled with your enterprise, or use actions directly from GitHub.com.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Setting up the tool cache on self-hosted runners without internet access
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: To use the included actions/setup actions on self-hosted runners without internet access, you must first populate the runner's tool cache for your workflows.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Advanced configuration and troubleshooting
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: Configure high availability for GitHub Actions, and troubleshoot GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: High availability for GitHub Actions
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: There are some special considerations for administering GitHub Actions in a high availability configuration.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Backing up and restoring GitHub Enterprise Server with GitHub Actions enabled
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: To restore a backup of your GitHub Enterprise Server instance when GitHub Actions is enabled, you must configure GitHub Actions before restoring the backup with GitHub Enterprise Server Backup Utilities.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Using a staging environment
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: Learn about using GitHub Actions with GitHub Enterprise Server staging instances.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.title: Troubleshooting GitHub Actions for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/github-.intro: Troubleshooting common issues that occur when using GitHub Actions on GitHub Enterprise Server.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.title: Managing GitHub Packages for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.intro: You can enable GitHub Packages for your enterprise and manage GitHub Packages settings and allowed packaged types.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.title: Getting started with GitHub Packages for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.intro: You can start using GitHub Packages on your GitHub Enterprise Server instance by enabling the feature, configuring third-party storage, configuring the ecosystems you want to support, and updating your TLS certificate.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.title: Enabling GitHub Packages with AWS
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.intro: Set up GitHub Packages with AWS as your external storage.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.title: Enabling GitHub Packages with Azure Blob Storage
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.intro: Set up GitHub Packages with Azure Blob Storage as your external storage.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.title: Enabling GitHub Packages with MinIO
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.intro: Set up GitHub Packages with MinIO as your external storage.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.title: Quickstart for configuring your MinIO storage bucket for GitHub Packages
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.intro: Configure your custom MinIO storage bucket for use with GitHub Packages.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.title: Configuring package ecosystem support for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.intro: You can configure GitHub Packages for your enterprise by globally enabling or disabling individual package ecosystems on your enterprise, including Container registry, Docker, and npm. Learn about other configuration requirements to support specific package ecosystems.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.title: Migrating your enterprise to the Container registry from the Docker registry
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/package.intro: You can migrate Docker images previously stored in the Docker registry on your GitHub Enterprise Server instance to the Container registry.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/code-s.title: Managing code security for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/code-s.intro: You can build security into your developers' workflow with features that keep secrets and vulnerabilities out of your codebase, and that maintain your software supply chain.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/code-s.title: Managing GitHub Advanced Security for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/code-s.intro: You can configure Advanced Security and manage use by your enterprise to suit your organization's needs.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.title: Enabling GitHub Advanced Security for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.intro: You can configure GitHub Enterprise Server to include GitHub Advanced Security. This provides extra features that help users find and fix security problems in their code.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/code-s.title: Managing GitHub Advanced Security features for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/code-s.intro: You can control GitHub Advanced Security features that secure and analyze code across all organizations owned by your enterprise.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/code-s.title: Configuring self-hosted runners for code scanning in your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/code-s.intro: You can enable, configure, and disable code scanning for GitHub Enterprise Cloud without GitHub-hosted runners. Code scanning allows users to scan code for vulnerabilities and errors.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.title: Configuring dependency review for your appliance
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.intro: To help users understand dependency changes when reviewing pull requests, you can enable, configure, and disable dependency review for your GitHub Enterprise Server instance.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.title: Configuring secret scanning for your appliance
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.intro: You can enable, configure, and disable secret scanning for your GitHub Enterprise Server instance. Secret scanning allows users to scan code for accidentally committed secrets.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.title: Managing supply chain security for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.intro: You can visualize, maintain, and secure the dependencies in your developers' software supply chain.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.title: About supply chain security for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.intro: You can enable features that help your developers understand and update the dependencies their code relies on.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.title: Enabling the dependency graph for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.intro: You can allow users to identify their projects' dependencies by enabling the dependency graph.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.title: Viewing the vulnerability data for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.intro: You can view vulnerability data from the GitHub Advisory Database on your GitHub Enterprise Server instance.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.title: Configuring Dependabot to work with limited internet access
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/code-se.intro: You can configure Dependabot to generate pull requests for version and security updates using private registries when your GitHub Enterprise Server instance has limited, or no, internet access.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/guides.title: Guides for GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/guides.intro: Learn how to increase developer productivity and code quality with GitHub Enterprise Cloud.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/all-rel.title: GitHub Enterprise Server releases
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/all-rel.intro: GitHub releases new versions of GitHub Enterprise Server regularly. You can review supported versions, see deprecation dates, and browse documentation for the release you've deployed.

/en/billing.title: Billing and payments documentation
/en/billing.intro: Learn about the different components of your bill, and how you can view and manage those components.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Managing your GitHub billing settings
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: Your account's billing settings apply to every paid feature or product you add to the account. You can manage settings like your payment method, billing cycle, and billing email. You can also view billing information such as your subscription, billing date, payment history, and past receipts.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: About billing on GitHub
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: Your bill is a combination of charges for your subscriptions, including your account's plan, and usage-based billing.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: About billing for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can view billing information for your enterprise account on GitHub.com.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Viewing your subscriptions and billing date
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: You can view your account's subscription, your other paid features and products, and your next billing date in your account's billing settings.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Adding or editing a payment method
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: You can add a payment method to your account or update your account's existing payment method at any time.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Viewing your payment history and receipts
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: You can view your account's payment history and download past receipts at any time.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Adding information to your receipts
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: You can add extra information to your GitHub receipts, such as tax or accounting information required by your company or country.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Setting your billing email
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: Your account's billing email is where GitHub sends receipts and other billing-related communication.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Changing the duration of your billing cycle
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: You can pay for your account's subscription and other paid features and products on a monthly or yearly billing cycle.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Redeeming a coupon
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: If you have a coupon, you can redeem it towards a paid GitHub subscription.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Troubleshooting a declined credit card charge
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: If the credit card you use to pay for GitHub is declined, you can take several steps to ensure that your payments go through and that you are not locked out of your account.

/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.title: Unlocking a locked account
/en/billing/managing-your-github-billing.intro: Your account's paid features are locked if your payment is past due because of billing problems.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: Managing the plan for your GitHub account
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: You can upgrade, downgrade, and view pending changes to your account's plan at any time.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: About billing for plans
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: GitHub offers free and paid plans for every developer or team.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: About per-user pricing
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: For organizations, your bill begins with the number of licensed seats you choose.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Viewing the subscription and usage for your enterprise account
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can view the current subscription, license usage, invoices, payment history, and other billing information for your enterprise account.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: Upgrading your account's plan
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: You can upgrade the plan for any type of account on GitHub.com at any time.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: Viewing and managing pending changes to your plan
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: You can view and cancel pending changes to your plan before they take effect on your next billing date.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: Downgrading your account's plan
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: You can downgrade the plan for any type of account on GitHub.com at any time.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Managing invoices for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can view, pay, or download a current invoice for your enterprise, and you can view your payment history.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: Connecting an Azure subscription
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: If you use GitHub through a Microsoft Enterprise Agreement, you can enable and pay for usage-based billing on GitHub.com by connecting an Azure subscription.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: How does upgrading or downgrading affect the billing process?
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: When you upgrade the subscription for your personal account or organization, changes are applied immediately. When you downgrade your subscription, changes are applied at the end of your current billing cycle.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: One-time payments for customers in India
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: Customers in India who have been impacted by the Reserve Bank of India's recurring payment regulation can now make one-time payments for their GitHub subscriptions and services.

/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.title: Discounted plans for GitHub accounts
/en/billing/managing-the-plan-for-your-g.intro: GitHub provides discounts to students, educators, educational institutions, nonprofits, and libraries.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Managing your license for GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: GitHub Enterprise includes both cloud and self-hosted deployment options. If you host a GitHub Enterprise Server instance, you must unlock the instance with a license file. You can view, manage, and update the license file.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: About licenses for GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: If you deploy GitHub Enterprise Server in addition to using GitHub Enterprise Cloud, you can synchronize your license usage between deployments, and use a license file to unlock each GitHub Enterprise Server instance.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Downloading your license for GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can download a copy of your license file for GitHub Enterprise Server.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/billing/manag.title: Uploading a new license to GitHub Enterprise Server
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/billing/manag.intro: You can upload your license file for GitHub Enterprise to your GitHub Enterprise Server instance to validate your application.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Viewing license usage for GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can view license usage for your enterprise on GitHub.com.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Syncing license usage between GitHub Enterprise Server and GitHub Enterprise Cloud
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can sync license usage from GitHub Enterprise Server to GitHub Enterprise Cloud to view all license usage across your enterprise in one place and ensure that people with accounts in both environments only consume one user license.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Troubleshooting license usage for GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can troubleshoot license usage for your enterprise by auditing license reports.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Managing licenses for Visual Studio subscriptions with GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: Visual Studio subscriptions with GitHub Enterprise is a combined offering from Microsoft that allows a subscriber to use both Visual Studio and GitHub Enterprise.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: About Visual Studio subscriptions with GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can give Visual Studio subscribers on your team access to GitHub Enterprise with a combined offering from Microsoft.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Setting up Visual Studio subscriptions with GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: Your team's subscription to Visual Studio can also provide access to GitHub Enterprise.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing billing for GitHub Actions
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can view your usage and set a spending limit for GitHub Actions.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: About billing for GitHub Actions
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: If you want to use GitHub Actions beyond the storage or minutes included in your account, you will be billed for additional usage.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Viewing your GitHub Actions usage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can view details of your usage of minutes and storage for GitHub Actions.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing your spending limit for GitHub Actions
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can set a spending limit for GitHub Actions usage.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing billing for GitHub Codespaces
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can view your usage and set a spending limit for GitHub Codespaces.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: About billing for GitHub Codespaces
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: Learn about the costs for using GitHub Codespaces, and the monthly usage quotas included with GitHub personal accounts.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Viewing your GitHub Codespaces usage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can view the compute hours and storage used by GitHub Codespaces.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing the spending limit for GitHub Codespaces
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can set a spending limit for GitHub Codespaces usage.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing billing for GitHub Packages
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can view your GitHub Packages usage and set a spending limit for GitHub Packages.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: About billing for GitHub Packages
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: If you want to use GitHub Packages beyond the storage or data transfer included in your account, you will be billed for additional usage.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Viewing your GitHub Packages usage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can view details of your usage of storage and data transfer for GitHub Packages.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing your spending limit for GitHub Packages
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can set a spending limit for GitHub Packages usage.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing billing for GitHub Copilot
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can set up a GitHub Copilot subscription through your personal or organization account. You can modify or cancel your subscription at any time.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: About billing for GitHub Copilot
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: If you want to use GitHub Copilot, you either need a subscription for GitHub Copilot in your personal account, or you need to be assigned a seat by an organization  with a subscription for GitHub Copilot Business.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing your GitHub Copilot subscription for your personal account
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: Set up your GitHub Copilot Individual trial for your personal account and manage your subscription.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing your GitHub Copilot subscription for your organization
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: Set up GitHub Copilot Business for your organization account and manage your subscription.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Viewing your GitHub Copilot usage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can view how many users have access to GitHub Copilot across your organization.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing billing for GitHub Advanced Security
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can view and manage your use of seats on a license for Advanced Security.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Setting up a trial of GitHub Advanced Security
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can evaluate the extra security features that GitHub makes available to customers with a GitHub Advanced Security license by setting up a free trial of GitHub Advanced Security.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: About billing for GitHub Advanced Security
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: If you want to use GitHub Advanced Security features in a private or internal repository, you need a license for your enterprise. These features are available free of charge for public repositories on GitHub.com.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Signing up for GitHub Advanced Security
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can sign up for GitHub Advanced Security from your enterprise account's settings to take advantage of extra security features that GitHub makes available to customers under a GitHub Advanced Security license.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/billing/manag.title: Viewing committer information for GitHub Advanced Security
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/billing/manag.intro: You can view information about the GitHub Advanced Security committers for your enterprise and calculate the cost for additional committers with the site admin dashboard.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Managing your GitHub Advanced Security licensing
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can add or remove GitHub Advanced Security licenses for your enterprise.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.title: Viewing your GitHub Advanced Security usage
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/billing/mana.intro: You can view usage of GitHub Advanced Security for your enterprise.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing billing for GitHub Sponsors
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can upgrade or downgrade the tier for each of your sponsorships.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: About billing for GitHub Sponsors
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You will be billed for your sponsorships with the rest of your paid products and features.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Upgrading a sponsorship
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can upgrade your sponsorship to a higher tier.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Downgrading a sponsorship
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can downgrade your sponsorship to a lower tier or cancel your sponsorship.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Setting an end date to a sponsorship
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can set an end date to an existing or new sponsorship.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Managing billing for GitHub Marketplace apps
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel GitHub Marketplace apps at any time.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: About billing for GitHub Marketplace
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: If you install a paid app in GitHub Marketplace, your subscription shares your account's existing billing date, payment method, and receipt.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Upgrading the billing plan for a GitHub Marketplace app
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can upgrade your GitHub Marketplace app to a different plan at any time.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Downgrading the billing plan for a GitHub Marketplace app
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: If you'd like to use a different billing plan, you can downgrade your GitHub Marketplace app at any time.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.title: Canceling a GitHub Marketplace app
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-github-.intro: You can cancel and remove a GitHub Marketplace app from your account at any time.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.title: Managing billing for Git Large File Storage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.intro: You can view usage for, upgrade, and downgrade Git Large File Storage.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.title: About billing for Git Large File Storage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.intro: If you purchase additional storage and bandwidth for Git Large File Storage, your purchase shares your account's existing billing date, payment method, and receipt.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.title: Viewing your Git Large File Storage usage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.intro: You can audit your account's monthly bandwidth quota and remaining storage for Git LFS.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.title: Upgrading Git Large File Storage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.intro: You can purchase additional data packs to increase your monthly bandwidth quota and total storage capacity for Git LFS.

/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.title: Downgrading Git Large File Storage
/en/billing/managing-billing-for-git-lar.intro: You can downgrade storage and bandwidth for Git LFS by increments of 50 GB per month.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: Setting up paid accounts for procurement companies
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: If you pay for GitHub on behalf of a client, you can configure their organization or enterprise account and payment settings to optimize convenience and security.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: Setting up paid organizations for procurement companies
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: If you pay for GitHub on behalf of a client, you can configure their organization and payment settings to optimize convenience and security.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: About organizations for procurement companies
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: Businesses use organizations to collaborate on shared projects with multiple owners and administrators. You can create an organization for your client, make a payment on their behalf, then pass ownership of the organization to your client.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: Creating and paying for an organization on behalf of a client
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: You can create and pay for a GitHub organization on behalf of a client.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: Upgrading or downgrading your client's paid organization
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: Billing managers can upgrade or downgrade a client's paid organization at any time.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: Renewing your client's paid organization
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: If your client's organization has a valid payment method on file, their yearly subscription will automatically renew. Billing managers can view and update the organization's payment method and subscription.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: Setting up enterprise accounts for procurement companies
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: If you pay for GitHub on behalf of a client, you can configure their enterprise account and payment settings to optimize convenience and security.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: About enterprise accounts for procurement companies
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: You can create an enterprise account for your client, make a payment on their behalf, then pass ownership of the enterprise account to your client.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: Creating and paying for an enterprise account on behalf of a client
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: You can create and pay for an enterprise account on GitHub on behalf of a client.

/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.title: Renewing your client's enterprise account
/en/billing/setting-up-paid-accounts-for.intro: You can renew your client's enterprise account by adding a payment method.

/en/organizations.title: Organizations and teams documentation
/en/organizations.intro: You can use organizations to collaborate with an unlimited number of people across many projects at once, while managing access to your data and customizing settings.

/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.title: Collaborating with groups in organizations
/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.intro: Groups of people can collaborate across many projects at the same time in organization accounts.

/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.title: About organizations
/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.intro: Organizations are shared accounts where businesses and open-source projects can collaborate across many projects at once, with sophisticated security and administrative features.

/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.title: About your organization dashboard
/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.intro: As an organization member, you can visit your organization's dashboard throughout the day to stay updated on recent activity and keep track of issues and pull requests you're working on or following in the organization.

/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.title: Best practices for organizations
/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.intro: Learn GitHub-recommended practices for your organization.

/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.title: Creating a new organization from scratch
/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.intro: Create an organization to apply fine-grained access permissions to repositories.

/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.title: Accessing your organization's settings
/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.intro: The organization account settings page provides several ways to manage the account, such as billing, team membership, and repository settings.

/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.title: Customizing your organization's profile
/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.intro: You can share information about your organization by customizing your organization's profile.

/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.title: About your organization’s news feed
/en/organizations/collaborating-with-gro.intro: You can use your organization's news feed to keep up with recent activity on repositories owned by that organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Viewing insights for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: Organization insights provide data about your organization dependencies.

/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.title: Managing membership in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.intro: After you create your organization, you can invite people to become members of the organization. You can also remove members of the organization, and reinstate former members.

/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.title: Inviting users to join your organization
/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.intro: You can invite anyone to become a member of your organization using their username or email address for GitHub.com.

/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.title: Canceling or editing an invitation to join your organization
/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.intro: Organization owners can edit or cancel an invitation to become a member of your organization any time before the user accepts.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.title: Adding people to your organization
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.intro: You can make anyone a member of your organization using their GitHub Enterprise Server username or email address.

/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.title: Removing a member from your organization
/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.intro: If members of your organization no longer require access to any repositories owned by the organization, you can remove them from the organization.

/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.title: Reinstating a former member of your organization
/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.intro: You can invite former organization members to rejoin your organization, and choose whether to restore the person's former role, access permissions, forks, and settings.

/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.title: Exporting member information for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.intro: You can export information about all of your organization's members from GitHub's web UI.

/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.title: Can I create accounts for people in my organization?
/en/organizations/managing-membership-in.intro: While you can add users to an organization you've created, you can't create personal accounts on behalf of another person.

/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.title: Managing people's access to your organization with roles
/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.intro: You can control access to your organizations's settings by giving people organization roles.

/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.title: Roles in an organization
/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.intro: Organization owners can assign roles to individuals and teams giving them different sets of permissions in the organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: About custom organization roles
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can control access to your organization's settings with custom organization roles.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Managing custom organization roles
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can create, edit, and assign custom organization roles in an organization's settings.

/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.title: Maintaining ownership continuity for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.intro: Organizations can have more than one organization owner to avoid lapses in ownership.

/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.title: Adding a billing manager to your organization
/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.intro: A billing manager is a user who manages the billing settings for your organization, such as updating payment information. This is a great option if regular members of your organization don't typically have access to billing resources.

/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.title: Removing a billing manager from your organization
/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.intro: If a person with the billing manager role no longer needs to view or change your organization's billing information, you can remove their access to the organization.

/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.title: Managing security managers in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.intro: You can give your security team the least access they need to configure and monitor code security for your organization by assigning a team to the security manager role.

/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.title: Managing moderators in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-peoples-acces.intro: You can give an individual or team in your organization the ability to block and limit access, by assigning them to the moderator role.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Managing user access to your organization's repositories
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: Organization owners can manage individual and team access to the organization's repositories. Team maintainers can also manage a team's repository access.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Managing repository roles
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can control the level of access that each person has to your organization's repositories by managing their repository role.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Repository roles for an organization
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can customize access to each repository in your organization by assigning granular roles, giving people access to the features and tasks they need.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: About custom repository roles
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can more granularly control access to your organization's repositories with custom repository roles.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Managing custom repository roles for an organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can create, edit, or delete custom repository roles for your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Setting base permissions for an organization
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can set base permissions for the repositories that an organization owns.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Viewing people with access to your repository
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can view a list of people with access to a repository within an organization.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Managing an individual's access to an organization repository
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can manage a person's access to a repository owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Managing team access to an organization repository
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can give a team access to a repository, remove a team's access to a repository, or change a team's permission level for a repository.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Managing outside collaborators
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can manage outside collaborators, or people who have access to repositories owned by your organization without being a member of your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Adding outside collaborators to repositories in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can allow people who aren't members of your organization to access repositories that your organization owns.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Canceling an invitation to become an outside collaborator in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can cancel all invitations for a person to become an outside collaborator on repositories owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Removing an outside collaborator from an organization repository
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: Owners and repository admins can remove an outside collaborator's access to a repository.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Converting an organization member to an outside collaborator
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: If a current member of your organization only needs access to certain repositories, such as consultants or temporary employees, you can convert them to an outside collaborator.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Converting an outside collaborator to an organization member
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: If you would like to give an outside collaborator on your organization's repositories broader permissions within your organization, you can invite them to become a member of the organization.

/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.title: Reinstating a former outside collaborator's access to your organization
/en/organizations/managing-user-access-t.intro: You can reinstate a former outside collaborator's access permissions for organization repositories, forks, and settings.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Organizing members into teams
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: You can group organization members into teams that reflect your company or group's structure with cascading access permissions and mentions.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: About teams
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: Teams are groups of organization members that reflect your company or group's structure with cascading access permissions and mentions.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Creating a team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: You can create independent or nested teams to manage repository permissions and mentions for groups of people.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Adding organization members to a team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: People with owner or team maintainer permissions can add organization members to teams. People with owner permissions can also invite non-members to join a team and the organization.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Assigning the team maintainer role to a team member
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: You can give a team member the ability to manage team membership and settings by assigning the team maintainer role.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Setting your team's profile picture
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: Team maintainers and organization owners can set a profile picture for a team, which is displayed on the team's page.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Managing code review settings for your team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: You can decrease noise for your team by limiting notifications when your team is requested to review a pull request.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Renaming a team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: Team maintainers and organization owners can edit the name and description of a team.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Changing team visibility
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: Team maintainers and organization owners can determine whether a team is visible or secret.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Configuring team notifications
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: Team maintainers and organization owners can configure notifications for specific teams.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Synchronizing a team with an identity provider group
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can synchronize a GitHub Enterprise Cloud team with a supported identity provider (IdP) group to automatically add and remove team members.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Moving a team in your organization’s hierarchy
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: Team maintainers and organization owners can nest a team under a parent team, or change or remove a nested team's parent.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Requesting to add a child team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: If you have maintainer permissions in a team, you can request to nest an existing team under your team in your organization’s hierarchy.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Requesting to add or change a parent team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: If you have maintainer permissions in a team, you can request to nest your team under a parent team in your organization's hierarchy.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Removing organization members from a team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: People with owner or team maintainer permissions can remove team members from a team. This may be necessary if a person no longer needs access to a repository the team grants, or if a person is no longer focused on a team's projects.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.title: Disabling team discussions for your organization
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.intro: Organization owners can choose to disable or enable team discussions across the organization.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Managing scheduled reminders for your team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: You can get reminders in Slack when your team has pull requests waiting for review.

/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.title: Deleting a team
/en/organizations/organizing-members-int.intro: Organization owners can delete teams at any time from the team's settings page.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.title: Collaborating with your team
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.intro: Within an organization, your team can work together across projects using team discussions.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.title: About team discussions
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.intro: Your team can plan together, update one another, or talk about any topic you'd like in discussion posts on your team's page in an organization.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.title: Creating a team discussion
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.intro: Any organization member can create a public team discussion post. To create a private team discussion post, you must be a member of the team or an organization owner.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.title: Editing or deleting a team discussion
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.intro: Organization members can edit or delete discussions on a team's page. If you're an organization member, you can edit or delete the discussion.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.title: Pinning a team discussion
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.intro: You can pin important discussions to your organization's team pages for easy reference, and unpin discussions that are no longer relevant.

/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.title: Managing access to your organization’s projects (classic)
/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.intro: As an organization owner or classic project admin, you can give organization members, teams, and outside collaborators different levels of access to classic projects owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.title: Project (classic) permissions for an organization
/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.intro: Organization owners and people with classic project admin permissions can customize who has read, write, and admin permissions to your organization’s classic projects.

/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.title: Managing access to a project (classic) for organization members
/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.intro: As an organization owner or classic project admin, you can set a default permission level for a classic project for all organization members.

/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.title: Managing team access to an organization project (classic)
/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.intro: As an organization owner or classic project admin, you can give a team access to a classic project owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.title: Managing an individual’s access to an organization project (classic)
/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.intro: As an organization owner or classic project admin, you can manage an individual member's access to a classic project owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.title: Adding an outside collaborator to a project (classic) in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.intro: As an organization owner or classic project admin, you can add an outside collaborator and customize their permissions to a classic project.

/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.title: Removing an outside collaborator from an organization project (classic)
/en/organizations/managing-access-to-you.intro: As an organization owner or classic project admin, you can remove an outside collaborator's access to a classic project.

/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.title: Managing programmatic access to your organization
/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.intro: As an organization owner, you can control access by apps and personal access tokens to your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.title: About programmatic access in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.intro: As an organization owner, you can control access to your organization by personal access tokens, GitHub Apps, and OAuth apps.

/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.title: Adding and removing GitHub App managers in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.intro: Organization owners can grant or revoke access for a user to manage some or all of the GitHub Apps owned by the organization.

/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.title: Reviewing GitHub Apps installed in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.intro: You can review the permissions and change the repository access for GitHub Apps installed on your organization. You can also temporarily or permanently prevent a GitHub App from accessing resources owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.title: Setting a personal access token policy for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.intro: Organization owners can control whether to allow fine-grained personal access tokens and personal access tokens (classic), and can require approval for fine-grained personal access tokens.

/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.title: Managing requests for personal access tokens in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.intro: Organization owners can approve or deny fine-grained personal access tokens that request access to their organization.

/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.title: Reviewing and revoking personal access tokens in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.intro: Organization owners can review the fine-grained personal access tokens that can access their organization. They can also revoke access of specific fine-grained personal access tokens.

/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.title: Limiting OAuth app and GitHub App access requests
/en/organizations/managing-programmatic-.intro: As an organization owner, you can choose whether to allow outside collaborators to request organization access for OAuth apps and GitHub Apps.

/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.title: Managing OAuth access to your organization's data
/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.intro: OAuth app access restrictions allow organization owners to restrict an untrusted app's access to the organization's data. Organization members can then use OAuth apps for their personal accounts while keeping organization data safe.

/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.title: About OAuth app access restrictions
/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.intro: Organizations can choose which OAuth apps have access to their repositories and other resources by enabling OAuth app access restrictions.

/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.title: Enabling OAuth app access restrictions for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.intro: Organization owners can enable OAuth app access restrictions to prevent untrusted apps from accessing the organization's resources while allowing organization members to use OAuth apps for their personal accounts.

/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.title: Disabling OAuth app access restrictions for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.intro: Organization owners can disable restrictions on the OAuth apps that have access to the organization's resources.

/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.title: Approving OAuth apps for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.intro: When an organization member or outside collaborator requests OAuth app access to organization resources, organization owners can approve or deny the request.

/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.title: Denying access to a previously approved OAuth app for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-oauth-access-.intro: If an organization no longer requires a previously authorized OAuth app, owners can remove the application's access to the organization's resources.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing organization settings
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: Organization owners can change several settings, including the names of repositories that belong to the organization and Owners team membership. In addition, organization owners can delete the organization and all of its repositories.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Verifying or approving a domain for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can verify your ownership of domains with GitHub to confirm your organization's identity.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Renaming an organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: If your project or company has changed names, you can update the name of your organization to match.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Transferring organization ownership
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: To make someone else the owner of an organization account, you must add a new owner, ensure that the billing information is updated, and then remove yourself from the account.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Restricting repository creation in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: To protect your organization's data, you can configure permissions for creating repositories in your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Setting permissions for deleting or transferring repositories
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can allow organization members with admin permissions to a repository to delete or transfer the repository, or limit the ability to delete or transfer repositories to organization owners only.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Restricting repository visibility changes in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: To protect your organization's data, you can configure permissions for changing repository visibility in your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing the forking policy for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can allow or prevent the forking of any private repositories owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing pull request reviews in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can limit which users can approve or request changes to a pull requests in your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Disabling or limiting GitHub Actions for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: Organization owners can disable, enable, and limit GitHub Actions for an organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Configuring the retention period for GitHub Actions artifacts and logs in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can configure the retention period for GitHub Actions artifacts and logs in your organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Setting permissions for adding outside collaborators
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: To protect your organization's data and the number of paid licenses used in your organization, you can configure who can add outside collaborators to organization repositories.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Allowing people to delete issues in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: Organization owners can allow certain people to delete issues in repositories owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Enabling or disabling GitHub Discussions for an organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can use GitHub Discussions in an organization as a place for your organization to have conversations that aren't specific to a single repository within your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing discussion creation for repositories in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can choose the permission levels that members require to create discussions in repositories owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing the commit signoff policy for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can require users to automatically sign off all commits they make in GitHub's web interface to repositories owned by your organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Setting team creation permissions in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can allow all organization members to create teams or limit team creation to organization owners.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Creating an announcement banner for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: Organization owners can create announcement banners for the organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing scheduled reminders for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can get reminders in Slack for all pull requests that teams in your organization have been requested to review.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing the default branch name for repositories in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can set the default branch name for repositories that members create in your organization on GitHub.com.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing default labels for repositories in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can customize the labels that are included in every new repository in your organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Changing the visibility of your organization's dependency insights
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can allow all organization members to view dependency insights for your organization or limit viewing to organization owners.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing the display of member names in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can allow members of your organization to see a comment author's profile name in private repositories in the organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing updates from accounts your organization sponsors
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can manage the email address that receives updates from accounts your organization sponsors.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing the publication of GitHub Pages sites for your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can control whether organization members can publish GitHub Pages sites from repositories in the organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Archiving an organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can archive an organization to make it read-only and indicate that it's no longer actively maintained. You can also unarchive organizations that have been archived.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Deleting an organization account
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: You can delete your organization account on GitHub.com at any time.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Converting an organization into a user
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: It's not possible to convert an organization into a personal account, but you can create a new personal account and transfer the organization's repositories to it.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.title: Integrating Jira with your organization project board
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/organizations.intro: You can integrate Jira Cloud with your organization account to scan commits and pull requests, creating relevant metadata and hyperlinks in any mentioned Jira issues.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Upgrading to the GitHub Customer Agreement
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: Organizations can upgrade from the Standard Terms of Service to the GitHub Customer Agreement.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Disabling projects in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: Organization owners can turn off organization-wide projects, organization-wide classic projects, and repository-level classic projects in an organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Disabling insights for projects in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: Organization owners can turn off insights for Projects in their organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Managing base permissions for projects
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: Organization owners can configure a base permission for projects created in their organization.

/en/organizations/managing-organization-.title: Allowing project visibility changes in your organization
/en/organizations/managing-organization-.intro: Organization owners can allow members with admin permissions to adjust the visibility of projects and classic projects in their organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Creating rulesets for repositories in your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can create a ruleset to target multiple repositories in your organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Managing rulesets for repositories in your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can edit, monitor, and delete existing rulesets to alter how people can interact with repositories in your organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Managing custom properties for repositories in your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: With custom properties, you can add metadata to repositories in your organization. You can use those properties to target repositories with rulesets.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Keeping your organization secure
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: You can harden security for your organization by managing security settings, requiring two-factor authentication (2FA), and reviewing the activity and integrations within your organization.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Managing two-factor authentication for your organization
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: You can view whether users with access to your organization have two-factor authentication (2FA) enabled or are required to enable 2FA, but haven't yet done so. Additionally, you can require 2FA in your organization.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Viewing whether users in your organization have 2FA enabled
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: You can see which organization owners, members, and outside collaborators have enabled two-factor authentication or are required to do so.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Preparing to require two-factor authentication in your organization
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: Before requiring two-factor authentication (2FA), you can notify users about the upcoming change and verify who already uses 2FA.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Requiring two-factor authentication in your organization
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: Organization owners can require organization members, outside collaborators, and billing managers to enable two-factor authentication for their personal accounts, making it harder for malicious actors to access an organization's repositories and settings.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Managing bots and service accounts with two-factor authentication
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: You can manage shared access to bots and service accounts that have two-factor authentication enabled.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Managing security settings for your organization
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: You can manage security settings and review the audit log and integrations for your organization.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Managing security and analysis settings for your organization
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: You can control features that secure and analyze the code in your organization's projects on GitHub.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Managing allowed IP addresses for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can restrict access to your organization's private assets by configuring a list of IP addresses that are allowed to connect.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Restricting email notifications for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: To prevent organization information from leaking into personal email accounts, you can restrict the domains where members can receive email notifications about organization activity.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Reviewing the audit log for your organization
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: The audit log allows organization admins to quickly review the actions performed by members of your organization. It includes details such as who performed the action, what the action was, and when it was performed.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Identifying audit log events performed by an access token
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can identify the actions performed by a specific token in your organization.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Displaying IP addresses in the audit log for your organization
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: You can display the source IP address for events in your organization's audit log.

/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.title: Audit log events for your organization
/en/organizations/keeping-your-organizat.intro: Learn about audit log events recorded for your organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Accessing compliance reports for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can access GitHub's compliance reports, such as our SOC reports and Cloud Security Alliance CAIQ self-assessment (CSA CAIQ), for your organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Managing SAML single sign-on for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: Organization owners can manage organization members' identities and access to the organization with SAML single sign-on (SSO).

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: About identity and access management with SAML single sign-on
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: If you centrally manage your users' identities and applications with an identity provider (IdP), you can configure Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) single sign-on (SSO) to protect your organization's resources on GitHub.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: About SCIM for organizations
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: With System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM), administrators can automate the exchange of user identity information between systems.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Connecting your identity provider to your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: To use SAML single sign-on and SCIM, you must connect your identity provider (IdP) to your organization on GitHub Enterprise Cloud.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Configuring SAML single sign-on and SCIM using Okta
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can use Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) single sign-on (SSO) and System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) with Okta to automatically manage access to your organization on GitHub.com.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Enabling and testing SAML single sign-on for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: Organization owners and admins can enable SAML single sign-on to add an extra layer of security to their organization.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Preparing to enforce SAML single sign-on in your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: Before you enforce SAML single sign-on in your organization, you should verify your organization's membership and configure the connection settings to your identity provider.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Enforcing SAML single sign-on for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: Organization owners and admins can enforce SAML SSO so that all organization members must authenticate via an identity provider (IdP).

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Downloading your organization's SAML single sign-on recovery codes
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: Organization owners should download their organization's SAML single sign-on recovery codes to ensure that they can access GitHub Enterprise Cloud even if the identity provider for the organization is unavailable.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Managing team synchronization for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can enable and disable team synchronization between your identity provider (IdP) and your organization on GitHub Enterprise Cloud.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.title: Disabling SAML single sign-on for your organization
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/organization.intro: You can disable SAML single sign-on (SSO) for your organization.
